intro: Polygala guineensis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow or greenish flowers that are often accompanied by specialized structures called蜜腺 (nectaries), which attract pollinators. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a slightly hairy texture. Polygala guineensis is often found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
